pros: I've been working at Rockwood for 12 years. I've never worked for anyone longer than 5 years. Rockwood has a track record for humanizing their employees. I don't feel like just a number. It is a family-type atmosphere, which I love. Helping the residents is a bonus, I feel needed.  And, I feel like if there is a possibility to utilize out-of-the-box talents, Rockwood is willing/open to let me utilize and grow those talents within the workplace. That speaks volumes.
cons: Even though I feel like more than just a number.... I've noticed some restructuring of management/communication and feel more out of touch lately (even with the online/offline newsletters).  The communication feels more corporate -- we've grown, which is not a bad thing... I just feel the communication end of things has lost part of the human touch.   It's not horrible, just noticeable.  I'd also like to say that it would be nice if our health care benefits were less expensive when adding a spouse and/or a dependent.  Is that possible?

pros: I look forward to my job each day because of the people I serve and the people I work with.  Rockwood South Hill is a beautiful campus .  I love the variety of my job as no day is ever the same!  This location is close to my home and convenient to much of the community .
cons: While I love that we do a lot of things and we wear a lot of hats, the hard part is always being busy.

pros:
